pageContext.claim: “Because of our regulatory and other reforms, we have more people working in the United States today than ever before.”
pageContext.analysis: The actual number of employed people is at the highest level. But in terms of the ratio of employed people in the total population (employment-to-population ratio), the U.S. is back to the levels prior to the 2007 economic recession, but it's not the highest ratio of people who have been employed, Bureau of Labor Statistics data show.
